description.narrative: Strengthening Community Security and Prevention of Violence against women in Tajikistan

Indicator 1.1. Status of the Law on Police and the Concept on community policing Indicator: 1.1.2. Number of legislative frameworks reviewed / proposed for amendments to criminalize domestic violence
Indicator: 1.1.3. Number of media reports with evidence of increased public discussion on stereotypes of gender roles contributing to violence and discrimination against women (e.g. in the media, parliament, local government, or other public forums). Output 2. All segments of target communities, including women, and youth and vulnerable can openly and closely interact with the local police on standing community security issues
2.1.1. Number of public council/ policy dialogue meetings facilitated for improved monitoring and reporting on implementation of the Police Reform 2.1.2. Number of DV cases identified by police due to provided expert support to the Multi-Disciplinary Working Groups on PDV. 2.1.3.Number of Community Police Partnership Team action plans implemented Output 3. Community level response to domestic violence strengthened in target districts through integrated and coordinated approach and service delivery among local actors, including police and justice practitioners 3.1.1. Number of police officers, judges, lawyers, and prosecutors trained on dealing with gender-based violations disaggregated by sex in pilot areas 3.1.2. Number of women who have received shelter, legal advice, psycho social consultations, medical, social and other services provided by sectoral referral mechanisms in select localities

comment.narrative:
Output 1. National policy and legislative frameworks on community policing and addressing domestic violence are enhanced through improved coordination, advocacy, innovative methods and application of human rights and gender-based (HRBA) and ‘do no harm’ approaches. Baseline 1.1. Law on Police is not adopted; Concept on community policing is not piloted
Baseline: 1.1.2. 0 DV is not classified as a crime in the current legislation Baseline: 1.1.3. 0
Output 2. All segments of target communities, including women, and youth and vulnerable can openly and closely interact with the local police on standing community security issues. 2.1.1. Policy dialogue platform/s 2.1.2.Government Sub-group led by General Prosecutors Office to respond to the cases of violence 2.1.3. 32 Output 3. Community level response to domestic violence strengthened in target districts through integrated and coordinated approach and service delivery among local actors, including police and justice practitioners Baseline ands targets TBD Baseline and targets TBD

Output 1. National policy and legislative frameworks on community policing and addressing domestic violence are enhanced through improved coordination, advocacy, innovative methods and application of human rights and gender-based (HRBA) and ‘do no harm’ approaches. 1.1. Law on Police is extensively discussed with the public
1.1.2. 0 1.1.3. 5
Output 2. All segments of target communities, including women, and youth and vulnerable can openly and closely interact with the local police on standing community security issues 2.1.1. 1 2.1.2. 10% increase in # of DV cases 2.1.3. 2 CPPT established Output 3. Community level response to domestic violence strengthened in target districts through integrated and coordinated approach and service delivery among local actors, including police and justice practitioners 3.2.1 50 prosecutors; 50 judges; 50 lawyers; 50 police; 20 bailiffs 3.2.2. 360 women who have received shelter, legal advice, psycho social consultations, medical, social and other services provided by sectoral referral mechanisms in selected districts

Output 1. National policy and legislative frameworks on community policing and addressing domestic violence are enhanced through improved coordination, advocacy, innovative methods and application of human rights and gender-based (HRBA) and ‘do no harm’ approaches. 1.1. Status of the Law on Police and the Concept on community policing
Target: Law on Police is strengthened and submitted for the Government’s review 1.1.2. Number of legislative frameworks reviewed / proposed for amendments to criminalize domestic violence
Target: 1 1.1.3. Number of media reports with evidence of increased public discussion on stereotypes of gender roles contributing to violence and discrimination against women (e.g. in the media, parliament, local government, or other public forums). Target: 10 Output 2. All segments of target communities, including women, and youth and vulnerable can openly and closely interact with the local police on standing community security issues 2.1.1. Number of public council/ policy dialogue meetings facilitated for improved monitoring and reporting on implementation of the Police Reform Target: 3 2.1.2. Number of DV cases identified by police due to provided expert support to the Multi-Disciplinary Working Groups on PDV Target: 15% increase in # of DV cases 2.1.3. Number of Community Police Partnership Team action plans implemented Target: 2 Action Plans developed Output 3. Community level response to domestic violence strengthened in target districts through integrated and coordinated approach and service delivery among local actors, including police and justice practitioners 3.2.1 Number of police officers, judges, lawyers, and prosecutors trained on dealing with gender-based violations disaggregated by sex in pilot areas Target: 50 prosecutors; 50 judges; 50 lawyers; 50 police; 20 bailiffs 3.2.2. Number of women who have received shelter, legal advice, psycho social consultations, medical, social and other services provided by sectoral referral mechanisms in select localities Target: 360 women received shelter, legal advice, psycho social consultations, medical, social and other services provided by sectoral referral mechanisms in selected districts

Output 1. National policy and legislative frameworks on community policing and addressing domestic violence are enhanced through improved coordination, advocacy, innovative methods and application of human rights and gender-based (HRBA) and ‘do no harm’ approaches. 1.2. Status of the Law on Police and the Concept on community policing
Result: Ongoing Activity, results for 2020 to be updated soon 1.1.2. Number of legislative frameworks reviewed / proposed for amendments to criminalize domestic violence
Results: 1 (Recommendations provided to draft Anti-discrimination law. 3 results were achieved in 2019 (Law of the Republic of Tajikistan on the Prevention of Domestic Violence; On State Guarantees of Equal Rights for Men and Women and Equal Opportunities for their Implementation; Law “On Legal Normative Acts of the Republic of Tajikistan”; 1.1.3. Number of media reports with evidence of increased public discussion on stereotypes of gender roles contributing to violence and discrimination against women (e.g. in the media, parliament, local government, or other public forums). Results: Results achieved in 2019; 6 (2 TV programme, 4 radio programms) media campaigns to discuss gender stereotypes and violence and discrimination against women have been conducted; Contract was until 16 Dec 2019) 2.1.1. Number of public council/ policy dialogue meetings facilitated for improved monitoring and reporting on implementation of the Police Reform Results: 2 (1 National coordination, 1 sum-national coordination in line with MIA suggestion) dialogue meetings for improved monitoring and coordination on implementation of the Police Reform have been conducted 2.1.2. Number of DV cases identified by police due to provided expert support to the Multi-Disciplinary Working Groups on PDV Results: 75 cases of domestic violence (72 women and 3 male) of cases of domestic violence have been referred to MDWG for consideration and support. Unfortunately, due to inconsistent case recording prior to project, and therefore no clear baseline, the project could not determine the exact % increase; however, all MDWGs confirmed they received more reports than in previous years. 2.1.3. Number of Community Police Partnership Team action plans implemented Results: 3 Action Plans were implemented in 2020. 3 small grants ($2,000) were dispersed for implementation of action plans developed and implemented by women and youth groups. All activities were completed during 2019-2020. Total of 6 Action Plans were developed and implemented to address harmful gender norms and behaviors that perpetuate gender discrimination, exclusion and violence (3 by CPPT and 3 by Youth Community Project) from October 2019 to January 2020. 3.2.1 Number of police officers, judges, lawyers, and prosecutors trained on dealing with gender-based violations disaggregated by sex in pilot areas Results: 22 prosecutors, 92 judges, 0 lawyers, 24 police officers, 27 bailiffs Total for 2019-2020: 84 prosecutors, 141 judges, 50 lawyers, 97 police officers, 46 bailiffs trained (418 participants: 362 men; 56 women) 3.2.2. Number of women who have received shelter, legal advice, psycho social consultations, medical, social and other services provided by sectoral referral mechanisms in select localities Results: 311 persons (258 women, 52 men and 1 child) have received shelter, legal advice, psychological consultations, medical, social and other services provided by sectoral referral mechanisms in selected districts Total for 2019-2020: 681 survivors of DV have received support (562 women, 116 men, 3 children).
